provenance.text_snippet:
Inclusion criteria
Patients must meet the following criteria for study entry:
1. Male or female.
2. Age ≥ 18 years old.
3. All patients must give written informed consent approved by the study site's Institutional Review Board (IRB)/Ethical Committee (EC).
4. Adult patients in whom a decision has already been made to perform a total hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision acetabular cup as per indication for use.
5. Patient is able to comply with the protocol.

values: Adult patients with any DELTA Revision acetabular cup contraindication for use as reported in the current local Instruction for use
For female patients, current pregnancy and/or lactation or planning a pregnancy

provenance.text_snippet:
Exclusion criteria
A patient will not be included in the study if they meet any of the following criteria:
1. Adult patients with any DELTA Revision acetabular cup contraindication for use as reported in the current local Instruction for use.
2. For female patients, current pregnancy and/or lactation or planning a pregnancy.

The patient population for this study will include adult subjects in whom the decision to perform a hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision acetabular cup must be taken prior to, and independently from the decision to include the patient into the study.
The expected duration of patient participation in the study will be around 2 years, with an expected recruitment period of 60 months.

studyArms.name: DELTA Revision Acetabular Cup
studyArms.label: Observational Cohort
studyArms.description: An open label, observational, prospective, longitudinal cohort study to evaluate safety, clinical and radiographic outcomes of total hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision cup.

provenance.text_snippet:
Treatment: Total hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision acetabular cup.
This is an observational study designed to reflect real life clinical practice as closely as possible. Thus, clinicians are free to choose the method to implant and total hip arthroplasty in accordance with the current local Delta Revision acetabular cup Indication for Use and current clinical practice
Study devices: DELTA Revision acetabular cup

_agentDocumentation.purpose:
Extracts the complete treatment design including study arms, epochs, dosing regimens,
    randomization configuration, and drug supply requirements. This is the primary source
    for IRT/IWRS and drug supply management system configuration.
_agentDocumentation.scope:
- Study arms (experimental, comparator, placebo)
    - Treatment epochs (screening, treatment, follow-up)
    - Study cells (arm × epoch matrix)
    - Dosing regimens (dose, frequency, route, cycle length)
    - Dose modification rules and triggers
    - Randomization details (ratio, stratification, block size, algorithm)
    - Drug supply kit configurations

keyInsights.name: Study Arms
keyInsights.description: Complete arm definitions with interventions, types, and allocation ratios

automationRules.description: Generate IRT arm configuration from study arms
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH arm IN studyArms:
                        CREATE irt_arm {
                            arm_code: arm.id,
                            arm_name: arm.name,
                            arm_type: arm.type.decode,
                            allocation: arm.allocationPercentage,
                            interventions: arm.interventions[].name
                        }
automationRules.example: {"arm_code": "A", "arm_name": "Drug + Chemo", "allocation": 66.7}

automationRules.description: Generate treatment assignment dropdown options
automationRules.ruleLogic: CREATE codelist 'TREATMENT_ARM' WITH values FROM studyArms[].name

keyInsights.name: Dosing Regimens
keyInsights.description: Dose, unit, frequency, route, cycle length, dose calculation basis

automationRules.description: Configure IRT dispensing rules from dosing regimen
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH regimen:
                        SET dispense_quantity = regimen.dose * regimen.frequency * cycle_length
                        SET kit_type = DERIVE_KIT(regimen.route, regimen.formulation)
                        SET dispense_visits = MATCH(soa_schedule.visits, regimen.schedule)
automationRules.example: 400mg BID x 28 days = 56 tablets per cycle, dispense at Day 1 of each cycle

automationRules.description: Validate dispensed dose against protocol regimen
automationRules.ruleLogic: IF dispensed_dose != protocol_dose AND NOT dose_modification THEN RAISE query

keyInsights.name: Stratification Factors
keyInsights.description: Randomization stratification with levels and definitions

automationRules.description: Configure IRT stratification from protocol factors
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH factor:
                        CREATE strat_factor {
                            name: factor.name,
                            levels: factor.levels[],
                            edc_field: DERIVE_FIELD(factor.name)
                        }
                    GENERATE strat_combinations = CARTESIAN_PRODUCT(all_factors.levels)
automationRules.example: ECOG (0-1, 2) × Prior Therapy (Yes, No) = 4 strata

automationRules.description: Generate stratification CRF fields
automationRules.ruleLogic: FOR EACH factor: CREATE dropdown_field WITH options = factor.levels

keyInsights.name: Dose Modification Rules
keyInsights.description: Reduction levels, triggers, hold/resume criteria

automationRules.description: Validate dose modification follows protocol levels
automationRules.ruleLogic:
IF new_dose NOT IN allowed_dose_levels THEN RAISE 'Invalid dose level'
                    IF dose_reduction_reason IS NULL THEN RAISE 'Reason required for dose modification'

keyInsights.name: Drug Supply Configuration
keyInsights.description: Kit types, dispensing schedule, supply model

automationRules.description: Generate kit configuration and depot requirements
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH kit_type:
                        SET initial_depot_stock = enrollment_target * cycles * safety_stock_factor
                        SET reorder_point = site_average_enrollment * lead_time_days

Treatment
Total hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision acetabular cup.

population.description: All enrolled patients who received the DELTA Revision acetabular cup.

provenance.text_snippet: The study will enroll approximately 49 adult subjects in whom the decision to implant DELTA Revision acetabular cup must be taken prior to, and independently from the decision to include the patient into the study.

variable.description: Change from pre-operative baseline in Harris Hip Score (HHS) at 2 years post-implant.

provenance.text_snippet: The primary endpoint is to assess the change in the Harris Hip Score (HHS) from pre-operative baseline up to 2 years after surgery.

intercurrent_events.name: Patient lost to follow-up or withdrawal
intercurrent_events.description: Patient does not complete the 2-year follow-up visit for any reason, leading to missing HHS data.
intercurrent_events.strategy_rationale: The primary analysis is a paired T-test, which implicitly uses a complete case analysis, excluding patients with missing data for the 2-year timepoint.

provenance.text_snippet: Assuming a 40% loss to follow-up, total enrolment for this study is set at 49 subjects.

The primary endpoint is to assess the change in the Harris Hip Score (HHS) from pre-operative baseline up to 2 years after surgery. A 20 point increase in the HHS is considered a minimal clinically relevant change for the purposes of this study. The specific hypotheses to be tested are:
Ho: D ≤ 20
Ha: D > 20

provenance.text_snippet:
Inclusion criteria
Patients must meet the following criteria for study entry:
1. Male or female.
2. Age ≥ 18 years old.
3. All patients must give written informed consent...
4. Adult patients in whom a decision has already been made to perform a total hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision acetabular cup...
5. Patient is able to comply with the protocol.

Exclusion criteria
1. Adult patients with any DELTA Revision acetabular cup contraindication for use...
2.

2 Objectives

2.1 Primary objectives
The primary objective for this study is to assess the clinical outcomes of the DELTA Revision acetabular cup used in real life settings over a period of 2 years.

statistical_methods.name: Primary Endpoint Analysis Method
statistical_methods.description: A standard one-sided paired T-test will be used to test the hypothesis that the mean change from baseline in HHS at 2 years is greater than 20 points.

provenance.text_snippet:
For the primary endpoint, a standard one-sided paired T-test will be used to test the hypotheses shown above in section 10.1. The test statistic is:
t = D-20 / SD/√n
Where
SD = √Σ(Di − D)2 / n − 1
and t follows a T-distribution with n-1 degrees of freedom. A significant increase in HHS will be claimed if the p-value from this test is less than or equal to 0.05

statistical_methods.name: Secondary Endpoints Analysis Method
statistical_methods.description: Secondary endpoints (ROM, OHS, radiographic evaluation) will be summarized using descriptive statistics. Continuous variables will be summarized using mean, standard deviation, N, and range. Categorical variables will be summarized using frequencies and proportions.

provenance.text_snippet:
Secondary Endpoints
The secondary endpoints of range of motion, Oxford Hip Score, and radiographic evaluation and stability assessment will be summarized using descriptive statistics at each follow-up time point indicated in section 4.2. Continuous variable will be summarized using the mean, standard deviation, N, and range. Categorical variable will be summarized frequencies and proportions.

statistical_methods.name: Implant Survivorship Analysis Method
statistical_methods.description: Survival of the implant at 2 years will be calculated using Kaplan-Meier methods. Observations will be censored at two years if the implant survives longer.

provenance.text_snippet: Survival of the implant at 2 years will be calculate using Kaplan-Meier methods. If the implant survives longer than two years, the observation will be censored at two years.

statistical_methods.name: Safety Analysis Method
statistical_methods.description: All adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse device effects, and serious adverse device effects will be summarized using frequencies and percentages and presented in tabular form.

provenance.text_snippet: All adverse events, serious adverse events, adverse device effects, and serious adverse device effects will summarized using frequencies and percentages and presented in tabular form.

missing_data_handling.method_description: For the primary endpoint, the paired T-test will only include subjects with both a pre-operative baseline and a 2-year post-implant HHS value. No imputation methods are specified.

provenance.text_snippet: A standard one-sided paired T-test with a sample size of 29 pairs will afford 90% power to detect an increase of 20 points on the HHS test. Assuming a 40% loss to follow-up, total enrolment for this study is set at 49 subjects.

10 Statistical considerations
All analyses will be performed using SAS version 9.3 or higher.
An open label, observational, prospective, longitudinal cohort study to evaluate safety, clinical and radiographic outcomes of total hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision cup.

_agentDocumentation.purpose:
Extracts study objectives, endpoints, estimands (per ICH E9 R1), analysis populations,
    and statistical analysis specifications. This is the definitive source for programming
    analysis datasets and statistical outputs.
_agentDocumentation.scope:
- Primary, secondary, and exploratory objectives
    - Endpoint definitions with outcome types and assessment methods
    - ICH E9(R1) compliant estimands with intercurrent event strategies
    - Analysis populations (ITT, mITT, PP, Safety)
    - Sensitivity and subgroup analyses
    - Multiplicity adjustment strategy
    - Missing data handling

keyInsights.name: Primary Endpoints
keyInsights.description: Primary efficacy endpoints with outcome type, timepoints, and assessment method

automationRules.description: Generate ADaM ADEFF specification from primary endpoint
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH primary_endpoint:
                        CREATE adam_spec {
                            dataset: 'ADEFF' or 'ADTTE',
                            paramcd: DERIVE_PARAMCD(endpoint.name),
                            param: endpoint.text,
                            dtype: endpoint.outcome_type.decode,
                            avisit: endpoint.primary_timepoint_text
                        }

keyInsights.name: Estimands
keyInsights.description: ICH E9(R1) estimands with treatment comparison, population, variable, ICE strategies

automationRules.description: Generate SAP estimand section from extracted estimands
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH estimand:
                        GENERATE estimand_table {
                            population: estimand.population.description,
                            treatment: estimand.treatment,
                            variable: estimand.variable.description,
                            intercurrent_events: estimand.intercurrent_events[],
                            summary_measure: estimand.summary_measure.decode
                        }

keyInsights.name: Analysis Populations
keyInsights.description: ITT, mITT, PP, Safety population definitions with inclusion/exclusion criteria

automationRules.description: Generate ADSL population flags from definitions
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH population:
                        CREATE adsl_flag {
                            flag_name: population.label + 'FL',
                            definition: population.text,
                            inclusion_criteria: population.inclusion_criteria,
                            exclusion_criteria: population.exclusion_criteria
                        }
automationRules.example: ITTFL = 'Y' if randomized and received ≥1 dose

ae_definitions.ae_definition: Any untoward medical occurrence, unintended disease or injury, or untoward clinical signs, including abnormal laboratory findings, in subjects, users or other persons, whether or not related to the investigational medical device. This definition includes events related to the investigational medical devices or events related to the procedures involved.
ae_definitions.teae_definition: AEs occurring after and during the implant.
ae_definitions.collection_start: After informed consent has been obtained
ae_definitions.collection_end: Until the event has subsided or values have returned to baseline, or in the case of permanent impairment, till the condition stabilizes.
ae_definitions.pre_existing_condition_handling: A preexisting medical condition should be recorded as an AE only if the frequency, severity, or character of the condition worsens during the study.

provenance.text_snippet: An adverse event (AE) is any untoward medical occurrence, unintended disease or injury, or untoward clinical signs, including abnormal laboratory findings, in subjects, users or other persons, whether or not related to the investigational medical device.

sae_criteria.sae_definition: A Seriuos Adverse Event (SAE) is any AE that meets any of the following criteria: led to death; led to serious deterioration in the health of the subject, that either resulted in a life-threatening illness or injury; led to serious deterioration in the health of the subject, that resulted in a permanent impairment of a body structure or a body function; led to serious deterioration in the health of the subject, that resulted in hospitalization or prolongation of patient hospitalization; led to serious deterioration in the health of the subject, that resulted in a medical or surgical intervention to prevent life-threatening illness or injury or permanent impairment to a body structure or a body function; led to serious deterioration in the health of the subject, that resulted in a chronic disease; led to foetal distress, foetal death or a congenital abnormality or birth defect; any revision of the implant independently if it requires the DELTA revision acetabular cup removal.

provenance.text_snippet: led to death;

criteria.definition: led to serious deterioration in the health of the subject, that either resulted in a life-threatening illness or injury

provenance.text_snippet: led to serious deterioration in the health of the subject, that either resulted in a life-threatening illness or injury;

criteria.definition: led to serious deterioration in the health of the subject, that resulted in hospitalization

A Seriuos Adverse Event (SAE) is any AE that meets any of the following criteria:

grade_definitions.label: Mild
grade_definitions.definition: The adverse event is transient and easily tolerated by the subject; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; or intervention not indicated.

grade_definitions.label: Moderate
grade_definitions.definition: The adverse event causes the subject discomfort and interferes somewhat with his/her daily activities; minimal, local, or non-invasive intervention indicated; or limiting age-appropriate instrumental activities of daily living.

grade_definitions.label: Severe
grade_definitions.definition: The adverse event causes significant discomfort to the subject and interferes significantly with his/her daily activities; medically significant, but not immediately life-threatening; hospitalization or prolongation of hospitalization indicated; disabling; or limiting self-care activities of daily living.

provenance.text_snippet:
The Investigators should be assessed the severity for AEs according to the following table:
Grade Severity
Mild The adverse event is transient and easily tolerated by the subject; asymptomatic or mild symptoms; clinical or diagnostic observations only; or intervention not indicated.
Moderate The adverse event causes the subject discomfort and interferes somewhat with his/her daily activities; minimal, local, or non-invasive intervention indicated; or limiting age-appropriate instrumental

causality_assessment.method_description: Investigators should use their knowledge of the patient, the circumstances surrounding the event, and an evaluation of any potential alternative causes to determine whether or not an AE is considered to be related to the medical device. Guidance includes: Temporal relationship, Known association with the medical device or similar procedures, Known association with the disease under study, Presence of risk factors, Presence of other related factors.

categories.definition: Causal relationship between AE and the medical device is determined by the investigator based on his or her clinical judgment.

provenance.text_snippet:
The causal relationship between AE and the medical device will be determined by the investigator based on his or her clinical judgment and classified into one of the following:
- Related
- Not related

Extracts comprehensive adverse event management specifications including AE/SAE definitions,
    grading systems, causality assessment, reporting timelines, and AESI lists. Critical for
    safety database configuration and pharmacovigilance workflows.

- AE and TEAE definitions

keyInsights.name: AE Collection Period
keyInsights.description: When AE collection starts and ends relative to study drug

automationRules.description: Validate AE dates within collection period
automationRules.ruleLogic:
IF ae.start_date < first_dose_date THEN SET ae.treatment_emergent = 'N'
                    IF ae.start_date > last_dose_date + followup_days THEN RAISE 'AE outside collection window'
automationRules.example: AE start date must be >= first dose date for TEAE flag

keyInsights.name: SAE Criteria
keyInsights.description: ICH E2A serious criteria with protocol-specific exceptions

automationRules.description: Configure SAE detection and expedited reporting workflow
automationRules.ruleLogic:
IF any(sae_criteria) THEN:
                        SET serious_flag = 'Y'
                        SET report_due_hours = sae_criteria.initial_report_hours
                        TRIGGER expedited_workflow
                        NOTIFY medical_monitor, sponsor_safety
automationRules.example: Death → 24hr initial report, 7-day follow-up

automationRules.description: Enforce SAE documentation requirements
automationRules.ruleLogic:
IF serious = 'Y' THEN REQUIRE (
                        seriousness_criteria IS NOT NULL,
                        onset_date IS NOT NULL,
                        outcome IS NOT NULL,
                        causality IS NOT NULL
                    )

keyInsights.name: Reporting Timelines
keyInsights.description: Hours/days for initial SAE report, follow-up, SUSAR

automationRules.description: Configure safety reporting timeline workflows
automationRules.ruleLogic:
CREATE workflow_rules:
                        - SAE initial: due_hours = reporting_procedures.sae_initial_hours
                        - SAE followup: due_days = reporting_procedures.sae_followup_days
                        - SUSAR: due_days = 15 (unexpected), 7 (fatal/life-threatening)
                    SET escalation_path = [site, medical_monitor, sponsor_safety, regulatory]

keyInsights.name: AESI List
keyInsights.description: Adverse events of special interest with monitoring requirements

automationRules.description: Prompt for AESI-specific data collection
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH aesi:
                        IF ae.meddra_pt IN aesi.matching_terms THEN:
                            DISPLAY aesi.additional_questions
                            SET aesi_flag = 'Y'
                            IF aesi.immediate_notification THEN NOTIFY medical_monitor
automationRules.example: Hepatotoxicity → Prompt for Hy's Law labs, trigger medical monitor alert

keyInsights.name: DLT Criteria
keyInsights.description: Dose-limiting toxicity definitions, observation period, MTD rules

automationRules.description: Configure DLT-based dose escalation rules
automationRules.ruleLogic:
SET dlt_window_days = dlt_criteria.observation_period_days
                    SET escalation_rules = {
                        '0 DLTs in 3': 'ESCALATE',
                        '1 DLT in 3': 'EXPAND to 6',
                        '1 DLT in 6': 'ESCALATE',
                        '>=2 DLTs in 6': 'MTD exceeded, DE-ESCALATE'
                    }
automationRules.example: 3+3 design with 28-day DLT window

5.5 Patient Withdrawal Criteria

The investigator has the right to withdraw a patient from the study at any time. In addition, patients have the right to voluntarily withdraw from the study at any time for any reason.

This is an observational open label, prospective, longitudinal cohort study designed to reflect real life clinical practice as closely as possible. Thus, clinicians are free to choose the method to implant and total hip arthroplasty in accordance with the current local Delta Revision acetabular cup Indication for Use and current clinical practice.

9 Safety Parameters and definition

Safety assessments will consist of monitoring and recording adverse events (AEs), including serious adverse events (SAEs), device deficiencies (DDs) and, adverse device effects (ADEs) including serious adverse device effect (SADEs); they are deemed critical to the safety evaluation of the study in the same way as the Unanticipated Serious Adverse Device Effects (USADEs).

_agentDocumentation.purpose:
Extracts actionable safety decision rules including dose modification triggers,
    study stopping rules, and organ-specific adjustments. These translate directly
    into EDC edit checks and medical monitor alert configurations.
_agentDocumentation.scope:
- Safety parameter categories discovered in protocol
    - Decision points with conditions and actions
    - Dose modification levels (reduction percentages, absolute doses)
    - Re-escalation criteria
    - Study stopping rules (individual and aggregate)
    - Organ-specific dose adjustments (hepatic, renal, cardiac)
    - Recovery/rechallenge criteria

keyInsights.name: Dose Reduction Levels
keyInsights.description: Defined dose levels (-1, -2, etc.) with absolute or percentage reductions

automationRules.description: Configure allowed dose levels in IRT
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH level IN dose_modification_levels.levels:
                        CREATE irt_dose_option {
                            level_id: level.level_name,
                            dose_value: level.absolute_dose OR (starting_dose * level.percentage/100),
                            kit_assignment: DERIVE_KIT(dose_value)
                        }
                    SET allowed_transitions = DEFINE_REDUCTION_PATH(levels)
automationRules.example: Level -1 = 300mg, Level -2 = 200mg, discontinue if further reduction needed

keyInsights.name: Decision Rules
keyInsights.description: If-then rules mapping safety findings to required actions

automationRules.description: Generate edit checks from decision rules
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH rule IN decision_rules:
                        CREATE edit_check {
                            trigger: PARSE_CONDITION(rule.condition),
                            action: rule.action,
                            message: 'Protocol requires: ' + rule.action + ' when ' + rule.condition,
                            severity: IF rule.action CONTAINS 'discontinue' THEN 'hard' ELSE 'soft'
                        }
automationRules.example: IF ALT > 5x ULN THEN 'Hold study drug, notify medical monitor'

automationRules.description: Configure real-time safety alerts from decision rules
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH rule WHERE rule.notify IS NOT NULL:
                        CREATE alert {
                            condition: rule.condition,
                            recipients: rule.notify,
                            urgency: DERIVE_URGENCY(rule.action),
                            include_data: [rule.parameter, subject_id, site_id]
                        }

keyInsights.name: Stopping Rules
keyInsights.description: Individual and study-level stopping conditions

automationRules.description: Configure enrollment stops based on stopping rules
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH stop_rule WHERE stop_rule.scope == 'study':
                        CREATE enrollment_hold_trigger {
                            condition: stop_rule.condition,
                            action: 'PAUSE_ENROLLMENT',
                            notify: ['sponsor', 'dsmb', 'irb'],
                            resume_requires: 'sponsor_authorization'
                        }

keyInsights.name: Organ-Specific Adjustments
keyInsights.description: Hepatic, renal, cardiac, hematologic dose adjustments

automationRules.description: Generate lab-triggered dose recommendations
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH adjustment:
                        CREATE lab_alert {
                            lab_test: adjustment.lab_parameter,
                            thresholds: adjustment.thresholds,
                            actions: adjustment.actions,
                            display_message: FORMAT_RECOMMENDATION(adjustment)
                        }
automationRules.example: CrCl 30-50 mL/min → Reduce to 75% of dose

    premedications. Essential for site guidance, eligibility verification, and drug
    interaction checking in EDC.

- Prohibited medications (with reasons and periods)
    - Restricted medications (with conditions for use)

    - Washout requirements
    - Drug-drug interactions (CYP450, QT, etc.)

keyInsights.name: Prohibited Medications
keyInsights.description: Completely banned drug classes with prohibition reasons and periods

automationRules.description: Alert when prohibited medication is entered
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH cm_entry:
                        IF cm_entry.drug_class IN prohibited_medications[].medication_class THEN:
                            IF cm_entry.dates OVERLAP study_period THEN
                                RAISE 'Prohibited medication during study period'
                            SET protocol_deviation = TRUE
automationRules.example: Strong CYP3A4 inhibitor during treatment → Protocol deviation query

keyInsights.name: Washout Requirements
keyInsights.description: Required washout periods before study entry

automationRules.description: Validate washout period for prior medications
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH prior_med:
                        washout = LOOKUP(prior_med.drug_class, washout_requirements)
                        IF prior_med.end_date + washout.duration_days > first_dose_date THEN
                            RAISE 'Insufficient washout period for ' + prior_med.drug_class
automationRules.example: Prior chemotherapy end date + 28 days must be before first dose

keyInsights.name: Drug Interactions
keyInsights.description: CYP450 inhibitors/inducers, QT prolonging agents with management

automationRules.description: Real-time drug interaction checking
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH new_cm:
                        interactions = MATCH(new_cm, drug_interactions[].affected_drugs)
                        IF interactions.length > 0 THEN:
                            DISPLAY interaction_warning(interactions)
                            IF interaction.severity == 'strong' THEN NOTIFY medical_monitor

keyInsights.name: Required Premedications
keyInsights.description: Mandatory premedications with dosing and timing

automationRules.description: Verify required premedications were administered
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH treatment_visit:
                        required_premeds = FILTER(required_medications, type='premedication')
                        FOR EACH premed IN required_premeds:
                            IF NOT premed_administered(premed) THEN
                                RAISE 'Required premedication not documented: ' + premed.name
automationRules.example: Diphenhydramine 50mg IV required 30 min before infusion

study_overview.study_purpose: To evaluate the safety, clinical, and radiographic outcomes of total hip arthroplasty with the DELTA Revision acetabular cup in a real-life setting over a 2-year period.
study_overview.study_duration_for_participant: Approximately 2 years from the date of surgery.
study_overview.number_of_participants: Approximately 49 participants at a single study center.
study_overview.study_locations: A single study center is expected to participate.

provenance.text_snippet:
Protocol Synopsis
Study title: An open label, observational, prospective, longitudinal cohort study to evaluate safety, clinical and radiographic outcomes of total hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision acetabular cup.
Primary objectives: To assess the clinical outcomes of the DELTA Revision acetabular cup used in real life settings over a period of 2 years

screening_procedures.description: Discussion of the study and signing the consent form before any study procedures.

screening_procedures.description: Collection of your medical history, hip history, demographic data (age, sex, etc.), and lifestyle habits.

provenance.text_snippet:
Medical History and Demographic Data
Medical history includes clinically significant diseases, hip history (including all prior hip therapies and procedures), osteoporosis history... Demographic data will include age, sex, ethnicity, smoking and drinking habits, activity level (e.g. sedentary, normal, intense) and, working status (active worker or retired).

screening_procedures.description: A complete physical examination, including assessment of your general health and musculoskeletal system.

provenance.text_snippet: A complete physical examination will be carried out at the pre-operative visit. This will include an assessment of all major systems as well as an assessment of the general appearance, lung/chest, abdomen, extremities and musculoskeletal.

screening_procedures.description: Measurement of body height, weight, temperature, pulse, and blood pressure.

provenance.text_snippet: Body height and body weight will be recorded only at the pre-operative visit and collected in the eCRF. Vital signs (body temperature, pulse, blood pressure) and ECG will be performed in accordance with current local practice at the study site...

screening_procedures.description: Completion of the Harris Hip Score (HHS) and Oxford Hip Score (OHS) to assess your hip pain and function.

provenance.text_snippet: Clinical evaluation will be performed at the following visits: Pre-operative visit: preoperative assessment will be used as baseline values for score improvement... Harris Hip Score and Oxford Hip Score will be used and evaluated for this study as detailed in the sections 7.6.1 and 7.6.2.

Radiological assessment was carried out preoperatively and postoperatively at discharge, at 2 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months after surgery. It included standard views, such as antero-posterior (AP) of the pelvis, antero-posterior (AP) and lateral (LAT) of the affected hip.

provenance.text_snippet: Study treatment is the hip replacement with implant of DELTA Revision acetabular cup.

known_risks.risk_description: Loosening, dislocation, or instability of the hip implant.

provenance.text_snippet: Adverse effects that most commonly and frequently occur in hip arthroplasty include: loosening of the prosthetic components; prosthesis dislocation and instability;

known_risks.risk_description: Infection of the joint or surgical site.

provenance.text_snippet: infection;

known_risks.risk_description: Temporary or permanent nerve damage near the hip.

provenance.text_snippet: temporary or permanent nerve damage;

known_risks.risk_description: Fracture of the bone or the implant device.

provenance.text_snippet: fractures of the devices;

known_risks.risk_description: Blood clots in the legs (venous thrombosis) which can travel to the lungs (pulmonary embolism).

provenance.text_snippet: General complications include venous thrombosis with/without pulmonary embolism, cardiovascular disturbances, haematomas, systemic allergic reactions and systemic pain.

known_risks.risk_description: Difference in leg length after surgery.

provenance.text_snippet: limb length discrepancies;

risks.reproductive_risks: The effects of this procedure on an unborn baby or a nursing infant are unknown. You cannot participate if you are pregnant, planning a pregnancy, or breastfeeding.
risks.risk_mitigation_measures: Careful pre-operative planning, proper surgical technique, and following post-operative rehabilitation instructions can help reduce the risk of complications.

potential_benefits: The hip replacement surgery is intended to reduce your hip pain and improve your mobility and ability to perform daily activities.
benefits.no_benefit_statement: Participation in the data collection aspect of this study does not provide any additional medical benefit beyond receiving the surgical treatment itself.
benefits.societal_benefits: The information gathered in this study will help to evaluate the performance and safety of the hip implant, which may benefit future patients.

provenance.text_snippet: The main goal of a hip joint prosthesis is to reproduce the articular anatomy reducing pain and give articular mobility to the patient. The degree of pain reduction and mobility depends in part on the pre-operative situation, intra-operative options and on the post-op rehabilitation.

alternatives.standard_of_care_description: The procedure in this study, total hip arthroplasty with the DELTA Revision cup, is considered a standard treatment for your condition. This observational study is designed to reflect real-life clinical practice.

provenance.text_snippet: The HHS is an outcome measure administered by a qualified health care professional, such as a physician or a physical therapist.

Harris Hip Score will be performed at pre-operative visit, discharge visit and, follow-Up 2 months (± 30 days), follow-Up 6 months (± 60 days), follow-Up 12 months (± 6 months) and follow-Up 24 months (± 6 months) since the date of the surgery.
Pain domain contributes 44 points
function 47
absence of deformity 4 points
ROM 5

scoring.scoring_algorithm: Sum of domain scores. Total score range 0-100. Higher score is better.
scoring.responder_definition: An increase of 20 points in the HHS is considered a minimal clinically relevant change.

provenance.text_snippet: The primary endpoint is to assess the change in the Harris Hip Score (HHS) from pre-operative baseline up to 2 years after surgery. A 20 point increase in the HHS is considered a minimal clinically relevant change for the purposes of this study.
The Harris Hip Scale (HHS) was developed for the assessment of the results of hip surgery, and it is intended to evaluate various hip disabilities and methods of treatment in an adult population.
An Electronic Data Capture system will be used to collect data in electronic format. Data will be collected at the following time-points:

Oxford Hip Score will be performed at pre-operative visit, discharge visit and, follow-Up 2 months (± 30 days), follow-Up 6 months (± 60 days), follow-Up 12 months (± 6 months) and follow-Up 24 months (± 6 months) since the date of the surgery.

scoring.scoring_algorithm: 12 items, each scored 0-4. Total score range 0-48. Higher score is better outcome.

provenance.text_snippet: The OHS is a short 12-item survey that can be done with pen and paper. Patients are asked to reflect on their pain and functional ability over the previous weeks. There are two domains (pain and function) with six items or questions in each, using the following scoring: each question has been scored between 0 and 4, with 4 being the best outcome, producing overall scores running from 0 to 48, with 48 being the best outcome.
The Oxford Hip Score (OHS) is a joint-specific, patient-reported outcome (PRO) measure, or PROM, designed to assess disability in patients undergoing total hip replacement (THR) [10].

eCRFs are to be completed using a Sponsor-designated EDC system.

Secondary endpoints:
- Evaluation of Range of Motion (ROM) at pre-operative visit, intraoperatively/discharge, 2 months, 6 months, 1 year and 2 years after the implant;
Radiographic implant evaluation and stability assessment of the DELTA Revision acetabular cup at the following timepoints: at discharge, 2 months, 6 months, 1 year, and 2 years after the implant

statistical_methods: Standard one-sided paired T-test for the primary endpoint (HHS change from baseline)
Descriptive statistics for secondary endpoints (ROM, OHS, radiographic evaluation)
Kaplan-Meier methods for survival of the implant

data.name: Withdrawal and Discontinuation Procedures
data.description: Procedural specifications for subject withdrawal and discontinuation

discontinuation_types.definition: Patients have the right to voluntarily withdraw from the study at any time for any reason. The investigator also has the right to withdraw a patient.

provenance.text_snippet: The investigator has the right to withdraw a patient from the study at any time. In addition, patients have the right to voluntarily withdraw from the study at any time for any reason.

consent_withdrawal.right_to_withdraw: Patients have the right to voluntarily withdraw from the study at any time for any reason.
consent_withdrawal.withdrawal_process: The primary reason for withdrawal from the study should be documented on the appropriate eCRF and on the patient's medical charts.

data_handling_options.description: If a patient withdraws, data will be collected up to the time of withdrawal, with no additional information collected thereafter.
Patients may also request that any previously collected data be excluded from the study.

consent_withdrawal.consequences: No penalty or loss of benefits for withdrawing.

provenance.text_snippet:
The investigator has the right to withdraw a patient from the study at any time. In addition, patients have the right to voluntarily withdraw from the study at any time for any reason. Reasons for withdrawal from the study may include, but are not limited to, the following:
...
Patient withdrawal of consent at any time

Every effort should be made to obtain information on patients who withdraw from the study. The primary reason for withdrawal from the study should be documented on the appropriate eCRF and on the patient's medical charts.

ae_followup.followup_until: Patients who withdraw from the study prematurely will be followed for all unresolved AEs/ADEs and SAEs/SADEs until their resolution or stabilization, the patient is lost to follow-up or dies, or until it is determined that the study participation is not the cause of the AE/SAE/ADE/SADE, whichever occurs first.

provenance.text_snippet: Patients who withdraw from the study prematurely will be followed for all unresolved AEs/ADEs and SAES/SADEs until their resolution or stabilization, the patient is lost to follow-up or dies, or until it is determined that the study participation is not the cause of the AE/SAE/ADE/SADE, whichever occurs first.

lost_to_followup.definition: Only after sufficient and documented unsuccessful attempts at contact have been made may a patient be declared “lost to follow-up."
documentation_required: Efforts to contact the patient should be documented in the source documents.

provenance.text_snippet: In the case of patients who do not show up for scheduled visits, site staff should make reasonable efforts (i.e., at least one attempt within a reasonable period of time after a missed visit) to contact these patients for follow-up information. ... Only after sufficient and documented unsuccessful attempts at contact have been made may a patient be declared “lost to follow-up." Such efforts should be documented in the source documents.

replacement_strategy.timing_cutoff: Patients who withdraw from the study will not be replaced.

provenance.text_snippet: Patients who withdraw from the study will not be replaced.

reasons.description: Any medical condition that the investigator or Sponsor determines may jeopardize the patient's safety if he or she continues in the study, or if it is in the best interest of the patient.
The study is closed by the Sponsor and/or by the Ethical Committes/Regulatory Authority.
Repeated patient noncompliance with protocol requirements or major protocol violation that may jeopardize the patient's safety.
The Sponsor has the right to terminate this study at any time. Reasons may include incidence or severity of AEs/ADEs, unsatisfactory patient enrolment, or inaccurate or incomplete data recording.

administrative_withdrawal.notification_requirements: The Sponsor will notify the investigator if the study is placed on hold, or if the Sponsor decides to discontinue the study or development program.

data_retention.retention_policy: If a patient withdraws, data will be collected up to the time of withdrawal. Patients may request that any previously collected data be excluded from the study. Withdrawn patients requesting data exclusion will be included as enrolled, implanted and withdrawn patients, but no implant or assessment data will be included in the eCRF and these data will be 'missing' in the respective population analyses.

provenance.text_snippet:
If a patient withdraws, data will be collected up to the time of withdrawal, with no additional information collected thereafter. Patients may also request that any previously collected data be excluded from the study.
Note: any withdrawn patients requesting that previously collected data are excluded from the study will be included as enrolled, implanted and withdrawn patients, but no implant or assessment data will be included in the eCRF and these data will be 'missing' in the respective

retention_strategies.re_consent_procedures: If during the study important new information becomes available, the consent form will be revised. Patients must be re-consented to the most current version of the Consent Forms.

provenance.text_snippet: If during the study important new information becomes available, the consent form will be revised. Patients must be re-consented to the most current version of the Consent Forms (or to a significant new information/findings addendum in accordance with applicable laws and IRB/EC policy) during their participation in the study.

data.name: H-34 Imaging & Central Reading
data.description: Radiographic evaluation specifications for the DELTA Revision acetabular cup.

provenance.text_snippet: An open label, observational, prospective, longitudinal cohort study to evaluate safety, clinical and radiographic outcomes of total hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision cup.

response_criteria.primary_criteria: Protocol-specific radiographic evaluation for orthopedic implants
secondary_criteria: DeLee and Charnley zones for radiolucency
response_criteria.modifications: Criteria are based on evaluation of implant stability, positioning, and bone response, not tumor measurement.

provenance.text_snippet: Imaging will be collected to evaluate the radiographic performance of the device, which will contribute to the overall efficacy evaluation of Delta Revision acetabular cup.

imaging_modalities.technical_requirements: Standard views, such as antero-posterior (AP) of the pelvis, and antero-posterior (AP) and lateral (LAT) of the affected hip.

provenance.text_snippet: Radiological assessment was carried out preoperatively and postoperatively at discharge, at 2 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months after surgery. It included standard views, such as antero-posterior (AP) of the pelvis, antero-posterior (AP) and lateral (LAT) of the affected hip.

assessment_schedule.post_treatment_schedule: 2 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months after surgery.

provenance.text_snippet: Radiological assessment was carried out preoperatively and postoperatively at discharge, at 2 months, 6 months, 12 months, and 24 months after surgery. It included standard views, such as antero-posterior (AP) of the pelvis, antero-posterior (AP) and lateral (LAT) of the affected hip.

lesion_requirements.measurable_disease_definition: This is not an oncology study. The protocol defines specific radiographic findings for evaluation.

provenance.text_snippet: An open label, observational, prospective, longitudinal cohort study to evaluate safety, clinical and radiographic outcomes of total hip arthroplasty with DELTA Revision cup.

response_categories.definition: Evaluated according to presence, absence, location and thickness in 3 zones (DeLee-Charnley). Graded as: 0 (None), 1 (<1 mm), 2 (≥1 to <2 mm), 3 (≥2 mm).

provenance.text_snippet:
Acetabular Component Radiolucency will be graded in accordance with the following definitions from the AP view:
0. None: No evidence of radiolucency.
1. < 1 mm: Presence of radiolucency <1 mm in thickness.
2. ≥1 to <2 mm: Presence of radiolucency ≥1 to <2 mm in thickness.
3. ≥2: Presence of radiolucency ≥2 in thickness.

response_categories.definition: Graded based on change in position of the acetabular component relative to the native bone stock. Graded as: 0 (Absent, <2 mm change), 1 (Present, ≥2 mm change).

provenance.text_snippet:
Acetabular Component Migration will be graded from AP view in accordance with the following definitions [17]:
0. Absent: No evidence of a change in position of the acetabular component relative to the native bone stock ≥2 mm.
1. Present: Presence of a change in position of the acetabular component relative to the native bone stock ≥2 mm.

response_categories.definition: Graded from AP view following the Brooker classification: Grade 0 (No evidence), Grade 1 (foci <1 cm), Grade 2 (< half space), Grade 3 (> half space), Grade 4 (bridges pelvis and femur).
Occurs if the head moves out of the acetabular component. Graded as: 0 (Absent), 1 (Present).

provenance.text_snippet:
Dislocation occurs if the head moves out of the acetabular component for any reason and will be graded from AP view in accordance with the following definitions:
0. Absent: No evidence of dislocation.
1. Present: Presence of dislocation.

response_categories.definition: Radiographic findings suggestive of infection. Graded as: 0 (Absent), 1 (Present).

provenance.text_snippet:
Infection will be graded from AP view in accordance with the following definitions:
0. Absent: No evidence of infection.
1. Present: Presence of infection.

central_reading.bicr_purpose: To perform image analysis and data management for radiographic endpoints.
central_reading.reading_methodology: Image analysis and data management will be performed by LimaCorporate.

provenance.text_snippet: All image analysis and data management will be performed by LimaCorporate in accordance with established and audited Standard Operating Procedures (SOPs). All electronic data and audit trails will be redundantly archived to prevent loss of data.

image_submission.anonymization_requirements: Images must be anonymized. No subject names or identifiers in the electronic header. Must include Study name (H-34, Delta Revision), Subject ID, and Date of X-ray execution.

provenance.text_snippet:
The anonymized X-rays data have to be uploaded directly in the eCRF.
In compliance with privacy laws to ensure and protect the confidentiality of the subject, no subject names or identifiers should be entered into the electronic header. The information requested below has to be entered into the electronic header in lieu of subject identifiers:
- Study name (H-34, Delta Revision)
- Subject ID (Site number-XX where XX is a progressive number according to each subject included at the site)
- Date

special_assessments.purpose: To measure the angle between the articular side of the acetabular cup and the transverse axis.
special_assessments.methodology: Measured from the AP Pelvis view.

provenance.text_snippet: Acetabular Inclination is defined from the AP Pelvis view and consists of the angle between the articular side of the acetabular cup and the transverse axis [15].

special_assessments.purpose: To measure the angle between the acetabular axis and the coronal plane.

provenance.text_snippet: Acetabular Anteversion is defined on a lateral view by the angle between the acetabular axis and the coronal plane [15] [16].

automationRules.description: Configure IRT dispensing rules from dosing regimen
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH regimen:
                        SET dispense_quantity = regimen.dose * regimen.frequency * cycle_length
                        SET kit_type = DERIVE_KIT(regimen.route, regimen.formulation)
                        SET dispense_visits = MATCH(soa_schedule.visits, regimen.schedule)
automationRules.example: 400mg BID x 28 days = 56 tablets per cycle, dispense at Day 1 of each cycle

automationRules.description: Validate dispensed dose against protocol regimen
automationRules.ruleLogic: IF dispensed_dose != protocol_dose AND NOT dose_modification THEN RAISE query

keyInsights.name: Stratification Factors
keyInsights.description: Randomization stratification with levels and definitions

automationRules.description: Configure IRT stratification from protocol factors
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH factor:
                        CREATE strat_factor {
                            name: factor.name,
                            levels: factor.levels[],
                            edc_field: DERIVE_FIELD(factor.name)
                        }
                    GENERATE strat_combinations = CARTESIAN_PRODUCT(all_factors.levels)
automationRules.example: ECOG (0-1, 2) × Prior Therapy (Yes, No) = 4 strata

automationRules.description: Generate stratification CRF fields
automationRules.ruleLogic: FOR EACH factor: CREATE dropdown_field WITH options = factor.levels

keyInsights.name: Dose Modification Rules
keyInsights.description: Reduction levels, triggers, hold/resume criteria

automationRules.description: Validate dose modification follows protocol levels
automationRules.ruleLogic:
IF new_dose NOT IN allowed_dose_levels THEN RAISE 'Invalid dose level'
                    IF dose_reduction_reason IS NULL THEN RAISE 'Reason required for dose modification'

keyInsights.name: Drug Supply Configuration
keyInsights.description: Kit types, dispensing schedule, supply model

automationRules.description: Generate kit configuration and depot requirements
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH kit_type:
                        SET initial_depot_stock = enrollment_target * cycles * safety_stock_factor
                        SET reorder_point = site_average_enrollment * lead_time_days

automationUseCases: Auto-generate IRT randomization and drug dispensing configuration
Create EDC treatment assignment and dose modification CRFs
Configure drug supply forecasting models
Generate pharmacy manuals and dispensing instructions
Set up stratification factor data entry forms
Configure enrollment caps by stratum/region

automationRules.description: Generate IRT arm configuration from study arms
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH arm IN studyArms:
                        CREATE irt_arm {
                            arm_code: arm.id,
                            arm_name: arm.name,
                            arm_type: arm.type.decode,
                            allocation: arm.allocationPercentage,
                            interventions: arm.interventions[].name
                        }

automationRules.description: Generate treatment assignment dropdown options
automationRules.ruleLogic: CREATE codelist 'TREATMENT_ARM' WITH values FROM studyArms[].name

endpoints_estimands_sap.purpose:
Extracts study objectives, endpoints, estimands (per ICH E9 R1), analysis populations,
    and statistical analysis specifications. This is the definitive source for programming
    analysis datasets and statistical outputs.
endpoints_estimands_sap.scope:
- Primary, secondary, and exploratory objectives
    - Endpoint definitions with outcome types and assessment methods
    - ICH E9(R1) compliant estimands with intercurrent event strategies
    - Analysis populations (ITT, mITT, PP, Safety)
    - Sensitivity and subgroup analyses
    - Multiplicity adjustment strategy
    - Missing data handling

keyInsights.name: Primary Endpoints
keyInsights.description: Primary efficacy endpoints with outcome type, timepoints, and assessment method

automationRules.description: Generate ADaM ADEFF specification from primary endpoint
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH primary_endpoint:
                        CREATE adam_spec {
                            dataset: 'ADEFF' or 'ADTTE',
                            paramcd: DERIVE_PARAMCD(endpoint.name),
                            param: endpoint.text,
                            dtype: endpoint.outcome_type.decode,
                            avisit: endpoint.primary_timepoint_text
                        }

keyInsights.name: Estimands
keyInsights.description: ICH E9(R1) estimands with treatment comparison, population, variable, ICE strategies

automationRules.description: Generate SAP estimand section from extracted estimands
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH estimand:
                        GENERATE estimand_table {
                            population: estimand.population.description,
                            treatment: estimand.treatment,
                            variable: estimand.variable.description,
                            intercurrent_events: estimand.intercurrent_events[],
                            summary_measure: estimand.summary_measure.decode
                        }

keyInsights.name: Analysis Populations
keyInsights.description: ITT, mITT, PP, Safety population definitions with inclusion/exclusion criteria

automationRules.description: Generate ADSL population flags from definitions
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH population:
                        CREATE adsl_flag {
                            flag_name: population.label + 'FL',
                            definition: population.text,
                            inclusion_criteria: population.inclusion_criteria,
                            exclusion_criteria: population.exclusion_criteria
                        }
automationRules.example: ITTFL = 'Y' if randomized and received ≥1 dose

adverse_events.purpose:
Extracts comprehensive adverse event management specifications including AE/SAE definitions,
    grading systems, causality assessment, reporting timelines, and AESI lists. Critical for
    safety database configuration and pharmacovigilance workflows.
adverse_events.scope:
- AE and TEAE definitions
    - SAE criteria per ICH E2A
    - CTCAE grading system version and definitions
    - Causality assessment methodology
    - MedDRA coding specifications
    - Reporting timelines (routine AE, SAE, SUSAR, pregnancy)
    - AESI list with special monitoring requirements
    - DLT criteria (oncology protocols)
    - Safety committees (DSMB, SMC)

keyInsights.name: AE Collection Period
keyInsights.description: When AE collection starts and ends relative to study drug

automationRules.description: Validate AE dates within collection period
automationRules.ruleLogic:
IF ae.start_date < first_dose_date THEN SET ae.treatment_emergent = 'N'
                    IF ae.start_date > last_dose_date + followup_days THEN RAISE 'AE outside collection window'
automationRules.example: AE start date must be >= first dose date for TEAE flag

keyInsights.name: SAE Criteria
keyInsights.description: ICH E2A serious criteria with protocol-specific exceptions

automationRules.description: Configure SAE detection and expedited reporting workflow
automationRules.ruleLogic:
IF any(sae_criteria) THEN:
                        SET serious_flag = 'Y'
                        SET report_due_hours = sae_criteria.initial_report_hours
                        TRIGGER expedited_workflow
                        NOTIFY medical_monitor, sponsor_safety
automationRules.example: Death → 24hr initial report, 7-day follow-up

automationRules.description: Enforce SAE documentation requirements
automationRules.ruleLogic:
IF serious = 'Y' THEN REQUIRE (
                        seriousness_criteria IS NOT NULL,
                        onset_date IS NOT NULL,
                        outcome IS NOT NULL,
                        causality IS NOT NULL
                    )

keyInsights.name: Reporting Timelines
keyInsights.description: Hours/days for initial SAE report, follow-up, SUSAR

automationRules.description: Configure safety reporting timeline workflows
automationRules.ruleLogic:
CREATE workflow_rules:
                        - SAE initial: due_hours = reporting_procedures.sae_initial_hours
                        - SAE followup: due_days = reporting_procedures.sae_followup_days
                        - SUSAR: due_days = 15 (unexpected), 7 (fatal/life-threatening)
                    SET escalation_path = [site, medical_monitor, sponsor_safety, regulatory]

keyInsights.name: AESI List
keyInsights.description: Adverse events of special interest with monitoring requirements

automationRules.description: Prompt for AESI-specific data collection
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH aesi:
                        IF ae.meddra_pt IN aesi.matching_terms THEN:
                            DISPLAY aesi.additional_questions
                            SET aesi_flag = 'Y'
                            IF aesi.immediate_notification THEN NOTIFY medical_monitor
automationRules.example: Hepatotoxicity → Prompt for Hy's Law labs, trigger medical monitor alert

keyInsights.name: DLT Criteria
keyInsights.description: Dose-limiting toxicity definitions, observation period, MTD rules

automationRules.description: Configure DLT-based dose escalation rules
automationRules.ruleLogic:
SET dlt_window_days = dlt_criteria.observation_period_days
                    SET escalation_rules = {
                        '0 DLTs in 3': 'ESCALATE',
                        '1 DLT in 3': 'EXPAND to 6',
                        '1 DLT in 6': 'ESCALATE',
                        '>=2 DLTs in 6': 'MTD exceeded, DE-ESCALATE'
                    }
automationRules.example: 3+3 design with 28-day DLT window

Set up expedited reporting workflows and timelines
Create EDC AE/SAE CRFs with proper grading dropdowns

Generate site training materials on AE reporting
Set up DLT tracking dashboards for dose escalation

systemConfigurations.outputFormat: Safety database import (Argus, ARISg, Oracle Empirica)

safety_decision_points.purpose:
Extracts actionable safety decision rules including dose modification triggers,
    study stopping rules, and organ-specific adjustments. These translate directly
    into EDC edit checks and medical monitor alert configurations.
safety_decision_points.scope:
- Safety parameter categories discovered in protocol
    - Decision points with conditions and actions
    - Dose modification levels (reduction percentages, absolute doses)
    - Re-escalation criteria
    - Study stopping rules (individual and aggregate)
    - Organ-specific dose adjustments (hepatic, renal, cardiac)
    - Recovery/rechallenge criteria

keyInsights.name: Dose Reduction Levels
keyInsights.description: Defined dose levels (-1, -2, etc.) with absolute or percentage reductions

automationRules.description: Configure allowed dose levels in IRT
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH level IN dose_modification_levels.levels:
                        CREATE irt_dose_option {
                            level_id: level.level_name,
                            dose_value: level.absolute_dose OR (starting_dose * level.percentage/100),
                            kit_assignment: DERIVE_KIT(dose_value)
                        }
                    SET allowed_transitions = DEFINE_REDUCTION_PATH(levels)
automationRules.example: Level -1 = 300mg, Level -2 = 200mg, discontinue if further reduction needed

keyInsights.name: Decision Rules
keyInsights.description: If-then rules mapping safety findings to required actions

automationRules.description: Generate edit checks from decision rules
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH rule IN decision_rules:
                        CREATE edit_check {
                            trigger: PARSE_CONDITION(rule.condition),
                            action: rule.action,
                            message: 'Protocol requires: ' + rule.action + ' when ' + rule.condition,
                            severity: IF rule.action CONTAINS 'discontinue' THEN 'hard' ELSE 'soft'
                        }
automationRules.example: IF ALT > 5x ULN THEN 'Hold study drug, notify medical monitor'

automationRules.description: Configure real-time safety alerts from decision rules
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH rule WHERE rule.notify IS NOT NULL:
                        CREATE alert {
                            condition: rule.condition,
                            recipients: rule.notify,
                            urgency: DERIVE_URGENCY(rule.action),
                            include_data: [rule.parameter, subject_id, site_id]
                        }

keyInsights.name: Stopping Rules
keyInsights.description: Individual and study-level stopping conditions

automationRules.description: Configure enrollment stops based on stopping rules
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH stop_rule WHERE stop_rule.scope == 'study':
                        CREATE enrollment_hold_trigger {
                            condition: stop_rule.condition,
                            action: 'PAUSE_ENROLLMENT',
                            notify: ['sponsor', 'dsmb', 'irb'],
                            resume_requires: 'sponsor_authorization'
                        }

keyInsights.name: Organ-Specific Adjustments
keyInsights.description: Hepatic, renal, cardiac, hematologic dose adjustments

automationRules.description: Generate lab-triggered dose recommendations
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH adjustment:
                        CREATE lab_alert {
                            lab_test: adjustment.lab_parameter,
                            thresholds: adjustment.thresholds,
                            actions: adjustment.actions,
                            display_message: FORMAT_RECOMMENDATION(adjustment)
                        }
automationRules.example: CrCl 30-50 mL/min → Reduce to 75% of dose

automationUseCases: Generate EDC edit checks for dose modification triggers
Configure IRT dose assignment validation rules
Set up medical monitor safety alert thresholds
Create dose modification decision trees for site training
Configure DSMB stopping rule monitoring
Generate lab-triggered safety alerts

systemConfigurations.description: Complete set of safety-related edit checks
systemConfigurations.outputFormat: EDC edit check specification (Medidata, Oracle, Veeva)

edit_checks.message: ALT elevation requires dose hold per protocol section 6.2
Neutropenia requires dose modification per Table 6-1

concomitant_medications.purpose:
Extracts medication restrictions, drug interactions, washout requirements, and required
    premedications. Essential for site guidance, eligibility verification, and drug
    interaction checking in EDC.
concomitant_medications.scope:
- Prohibited medications (with reasons and periods)
    - Restricted medications (with conditions for use)
    - Required premedications and prophylaxis
    - Rescue medications
    - Washout requirements
    - Drug-drug interactions (CYP450, QT, etc.)
    - Vaccine policy
    - Herbal/supplement restrictions

keyInsights.name: Prohibited Medications
keyInsights.description: Completely banned drug classes with prohibition reasons and periods

automationRules.description: Alert when prohibited medication is entered
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH cm_entry:
                        IF cm_entry.drug_class IN prohibited_medications[].medication_class THEN:
                            IF cm_entry.dates OVERLAP study_period THEN
                                RAISE 'Prohibited medication during study period'
                            SET protocol_deviation = TRUE
automationRules.example: Strong CYP3A4 inhibitor during treatment → Protocol deviation query

keyInsights.name: Washout Requirements
keyInsights.description: Required washout periods before study entry

automationRules.description: Validate washout period for prior medications
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH prior_med:
                        washout = LOOKUP(prior_med.drug_class, washout_requirements)
                        IF prior_med.end_date + washout.duration_days > first_dose_date THEN
                            RAISE 'Insufficient washout period for ' + prior_med.drug_class
automationRules.example: Prior chemotherapy end date + 28 days must be before first dose

keyInsights.name: Drug Interactions
keyInsights.description: CYP450 inhibitors/inducers, QT prolonging agents with management

automationRules.description: Real-time drug interaction checking
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH new_cm:
                        interactions = MATCH(new_cm, drug_interactions[].affected_drugs)
                        IF interactions.length > 0 THEN:
                            DISPLAY interaction_warning(interactions)
                            IF interaction.severity == 'strong' THEN NOTIFY medical_monitor

keyInsights.name: Required Premedications
keyInsights.description: Mandatory premedications with dosing and timing

automationRules.description: Verify required premedications were administered
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH treatment_visit:
                        required_premeds = FILTER(required_medications, type='premedication')
                        FOR EACH premed IN required_premeds:
                            IF NOT premed_administered(premed) THEN
                                RAISE 'Required premedication not documented: ' + premed.name
automationRules.example: Diphenhydramine 50mg IV required 30 min before infusion

automationUseCases: Configure EDC concomitant medication edit checks
Generate site reference cards for prohibited/restricted meds
Create eligibility screening tools with washout calculators
Set up drug interaction alerts in safety database
Auto-populate premedication requirements in visit forms

                                RAISE 'Prohibited medication during study period'
                            SET protocol_deviation = TRUE
automationRules.example: Strong CYP3A4 inhibitor during treatment → Protocol deviation query

automationRules.description: Validate washout period for prior medications
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH prior_med:
                        washout = LOOKUP(prior_med.drug_class, washout_requirements)
                        IF prior_med.end_date + washout.duration_days > first_dose_date THEN
                            RAISE 'Insufficient washout period for ' + prior_med.drug_class
automationRules.example: Prior chemotherapy end date + 28 days must be before first dose

automationRules.description: Real-time drug interaction checking
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH new_cm:
                        interactions = MATCH(new_cm, drug_interactions[].affected_drugs)
                        IF interactions.length > 0 THEN:
                            DISPLAY interaction_warning(interactions)
                            IF interaction.severity == 'strong' THEN NOTIFY medical_monitor

automationRules.description: Verify required premedications were administered
automationRules.ruleLogic:
FOR EACH treatment_visit:
                        required_premeds = FILTER(required_medications, type='premedication')
                        FOR EACH premed IN required_premeds:
                            IF NOT premed_administered(premed) THEN
                                RAISE 'Required premedication not documented: ' + premed.name
automationRules.example: Diphenhydramine 50mg IV required 30 min before infusion

crossAgentSynergies.automationEnabled: Site tool that calculates when patient becomes eligible based on prior meds
